example_1_add: aparaṃ pana, bhante, etadānuttariyaṃ, yathā bhagavā dhammaṃ deseti bhassasamācāre. idha, bhante, ekacco na c'eva musāvādupasañhitaṃ vācaṃ bhāsati na ca vebhūtiyaṃ na ca pesuṇiyaṃ na ca sārambhajaṃ jay'āpekkho, mantā mantā ca vācaṃ bhāsati nidhānavatiṃ kālena.
example_2: musā ca so na bhaṇati, atho na khīṇabyappatho, atho vebhūtiyaṃ n'āha, mantā atthaṃ ca bhāsati.
example_2_add: musā ca so na bhaṇati, atho na khīṇabyappatho, atho vebhūtiyaṃ n'āha, mantā atthaṃ ca bhāsati.
commentary: (DNa) na ca vebhūtiyan'ti bhassasamācāre ṭhito'pi bhedakaravācaṃ na bhāsati. (SNPa) vibhūtī'ti vināso, vibhūtiṃ kāsati karoti vā'ti vibhūtikaṃ, vibhūtikam'eva vebhūtikaṃ, vebhūtiyan'ti'pi vuccati, pesuññass'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. tañ'hi sattānaṃ aññam'aññato bhedanena vināsaṃ karoti. sesaṃ uttānattham'eva. (DNt) vibhūti vuccati visuṃbhāvo, tattha niyuttan'ti vebhūtikaṃ, tadeva vebhūtiyaṃ, pesuññaṃ. ten'āha bhedakaravācan'ti.

meaning_1: with room to repair; with space to fix
meaning_1_add: with room to repair; with space to fix; with a mend that counts
example_1: abandhan'okāso nāma patto yassa dv'aṅgulā rāji na hoti. bandhan'okāso nāma patto yassa dv'aṅgulā rāji hoti. navo nāma patto viññattiṃ upādāya vuccati.
example_1_add: abandhan'okāso nāma patto yassa dv'aṅgulā rāji na hoti. bandhan'okāso nāma patto yassa dv'aṅgulā rāji hoti. navo nāma patto viññattiṃ upādāya vuccati.
commentary: (KVt) bandhan'okāse sati vā asati vā bandhanavirahito patto abandhano, pañcabandhanānaṃ okāso assā'ti pañcabandhan'okāso.
commentary_add: (KVt) bandhan'okāse sati vā asati vā bandhanavirahito patto abandhano, pañcabandhanānaṃ okāso assā'ti pañcabandhan'okāso.
comment_add: since rāji here is 1.3 - crack; and because in the Vibhanga in Permutations bandhanokāsa does not present, when abandhanokāsa is present to count as a full offence - the meaning here - An almsbowl with a mend that counts; From BMC: “The Vibhaṅga to the following rule says that a bhikkhu may ask for a new bowl if his current bowl has five mends or more, the space for a mend (§) being two inches (fingerbreadths). The Commentary explains this first by saying that a bowl with five mends or more is damaged beyond repair, and thus loses its determination as a bowl. It then expands on the Vibhaṅga’s statements as follows: A clay bowl is damaged beyond repair if it has at least ten inches of cracks in it, the smallest of the cracks being at least two inches long. Cracks less than two inches long are said not to merit mending—this is the meaning of the Vibhaṅga’s phrase, “space for a mend”—and so do not count.

commentary: (VINa) ito paraṃ pana yv'āyaṃ paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjin'ti sampajānamusā bhaṇati, yasmā so n'atthi me paṭhamaṃ jhānan'ti evaṃdiṭṭhiko hoti, tassa hi atth'ev'āyaṃ laddhi. tathā n'atthi me paṭhamaṃ jhānan'ti evam'assa khamati c'eva ruccati ca. evaṃsabhāvam'eva c'assa cittaṃ n'atthi me paṭhamaṃ jhānan'ti. yadā pana musā vattu'kāmo hoti, tadā taṃ diṭṭhiṃ vā diṭṭhiyā saha khantiṃ vā diṭṭhikhantīhi saddhiṃ ruciṃ vā, diṭṭhikhantirucīhi saddhiṃ bhāvaṃ vā vinidhāya nikkhipitvā paṭicchādetvā abhūtaṃ katvā bhaṇati, tasmā tesam'pi vasena aṅgabhedaṃ dassetuṃ catūh'ākārehī'ti-ādi vuttaṃ. parivāre ca aṭṭh'aṅgiko musāvādo'ti (paṭi. 328) vuttattā tattha adhippetāya saññāya saddhiṃ añño'pi idha aṭṭhah'ākārehī'ti eko nayo yojetabbo.

example_1: anāpatti udakadantapone, cattāri mahāvikatāni sati paccaye asati kappiyakārake sāmaṃ gahetvā paribhuñjati, ummattakassa, ādikammikassā'ti.
example_1_add: anāpatti udakadantapone, cattāri mahāvikatāni sati paccaye asati kappiyakārake sāmaṃ gahetvā paribhuñjati, ummattakassa, ādikammikassā'ti.
commentary: (VMVt) apakatibhesajjattā vikaṭāni virūpāni visaharaṇato mahāvisayattā mahantāni cā'ti mahāvikaṭāni. (KVt) cattāri mahāvikaṭānī'ti gūthaṃ, muttaṃ, chārikā, mattikā ca āsayādi-vasena virūpāni jātānī'ti katvā vikaṭānī'ti vā apakatibhojanattā vikaṭāni virūpāni jātānī'ti vā attho.
commentary_add: (VMVt) apakatibhesajjattā vikaṭāni virūpāni visaharaṇato mahāvisayattā mahantāni cā'ti mahāvikaṭāni. (KVt) cattāri mahāvikaṭānī'ti gūthaṃ, muttaṃ, chārikā, mattikā ca āsayādi-vasena virūpāni jātānī'ti katvā vikaṭānī'ti vā apakatibhojanattā vikaṭāni virūpāni jātānī'ti vā attho.

example_1: mayā'pi kho etaṃ, brāhmaṇa, sutaṃ aggissa ādānaṃ yūpassa ussāpanaṃ mahapphalaṃ hoti mah'ānisaṃsan'ti. ta'y'idaṃ, bho gotama, sameti bhoto c'eva gotamassa amhākañ'ca, yadidaṃ sabbena sabbaṃ.
example_1_add: mayā'pi kho etaṃ, brāhmaṇa, sutaṃ aggissa ādānaṃ yūpassa ussāpanaṃ mahapphalaṃ hoti mah'ānisaṃsan'ti. ta'y'idaṃ, bho gotama, sameti bhoto c'eva gotamassa amhākañ'ca, yadidaṃ sabbena sabbaṃ.
example_2: na c'eso bhikkhu dhammavādī, na c'eso bhikkhu vinayavādī, m'āyasmantānam'pi saṅghabhedo ruccittha, samet'āyasmantānaṃ saṅghena, samaggo hi saṅgho sammodamāno avivadamāno ek'uddeso phāsu viharatī'ti.
example_2_add: na c'eso bhikkhu dhammavādī, na c'eso bhikkhu vinayavādī, m'āyasmantānam'pi saṅghabhedo ruccittha, samet'āyasmantānaṃ saṅghena, samaggo hi saṅgho sammodamāno avivadamāno ek'uddeso phāsu viharatī'ti.
comment: this example is different from sameti 2.4 since here the subject is "it" and it additionally takes +dat - may it agree for Venerables with the Sangha
